researchProjects.title: LLM-based C/C++ Vulnerability Detection Benchmark
researchProjects.introduction: In this project, I constructed a benchmark dataset of C/C++ vulnerabilities called SecVulEval. Previous datasets focused on file or function level artifacts which is unable to provide more granular understanding of vulnerable patterns, and do not incorporate contextual information into account. SecVulEval provides granularity down to statement level, and includes contextual information that affect the vulnerability.
descriptions: Collected 5,867 real-world C/C++ vulnerabilities from NVD database.
Curated 25,440 functions related to the vulnerabilities, and extracted vulnerable statements and contextual information affecting the vulnerabilities.
Designed and implemented an agentic vulnerability detection framework to evaluate various LLMs on C/C++ vulnerability detection.
Made the dataset publicly available at HuggingFace - SecVulEval for community use.
Published the details of the benchmark construction and evaluation in the paper SecVulEval: Benchmarking LLMs for Real-World C/C++ Vulnerability Detection.
